description: Single storey rear garden outbuilding for use as a gym/store room to ground floor flat
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s):
TP/539/OUT01 - Site and location plan, TP/539/OUT02 Rev A - Proposed site and floor plans, TP/539/OUT03 - Proposed elevations,
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.

| Notwithstanding the details shown on the plans, all external materials to be used in the development shall either be as per stated on the approved plans/ application form or shall match the appearance of those of the existing building.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D1 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| The outbuilding hereby permitted shall be used for domestic purposes incidental to the enjoyment of the main dwellinghouse at 5 Oakfield Gardens Greenford UB6 8SD and not for any other use. No cooking or kitchen facilities shall be installed into the outbuilding at any time.

Reason: To prevent the creation of a separate self-contained residential unit of accommodation in the interests of the living conditions of the existing and future residents of the  site and to ensure that the  use of the building does not, by reason  of  any  other  activity, harm the living conditions in the area, in accordance with policies 1.1,1.2 and 3.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), SPG4, policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document  (2013), policy D6 of  the  London  Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
